title.narrative: 4.2 CAP-SOCIAL INCLUSION

description.narrative: 104/002 By 2020, CAP governmental, non-governmental, and private sector partners, have increased capacity to advocate for policies and allocation of resources to programmes and policies on issues that affect the realization of the rights of the child., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Environmental Sustainability, Human Rights Institutions, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 4. By 2020, an enhanced policy environment and national and sub-national systems are in place for the realization of child rights, with a focus on equity, guided by knowledge and evidence.

description.narrative: Significant progress;was made for building awareness among decision-makers about child rights, including in the context of the COVID-19 pandemic and climate change. This is evident through the organization;of;two;parliamentary briefings;and;five;policy dialogues with high-level stakeholders, and proactive media relations | Status:Met | As-of Date:23/12/2021
